etymology.description: 廾(廾) (gǒng, "two hands") + 口(口) (kǒu, "an object") = holding up an object with two hands -> 廿(廿) (niàn) replaces 口 -> fused with 廾 -> 共(共)
etymology.interpretation: The character depicts two hands holding up an object, symbolizing 'togetherness' or 'unity.' The transformation from 口(口) (kǒu, "an object") to 廿(廿) (niàn) reflects a simplification in its graphic representation over time.

examples.chinese: 我们一起共度难关(我們一起共度難關)。
大家共商大计(大家共商大計)。
examples.english: Everyone discusses the grand plan together.

examples.chinese: 我们共谋未来(我們共謀未來)。
